usefulItems: 12-hole muffin tray, muffin wrap papers, bowl, wooden skewer, wire rack, oven
title: Carrot poppy seed muffins

ingredients.content: 1 orange, zest only, no white pith
1 tsp gluten free baking powder (see Tips)
1 carrot, peeled into thin ribbons, for decorating

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 170°C. Line a 12-hole muffin tray with muffin wrap papers and set aside.
Place almonds into mixing bowl and mill <b>2 sec/speed 9<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place sugar and orange peel into mixing bowl and mill <b>10 sec/speed 10<b>.
Add all remaining muffin ingredients, including reserved almond meal, and combine <b>5 sec//speed 6<b>, with aid of spatula.

Spoon muffin mixture evenly into prepared muffin tray and bake for 25-30 minutes (170°C), or until a wooden skewer inserted into the centre of the muffin comes out clean. Transfer onto a wire rack to cool completely (approx. 30 minutes).
Place 2 teaspoons crème fraîche on top of each muffin. Decorate with carrot ribbons and drizzle with syrup before serving.

hintsAndTricks: To make your own Gluten free baking powder, please refer to the recipe on this recipe chip.
Muffin wrap papers are available at most supermarkets. You can also use standard cupcake liners.
